item.name: Carga CPU
item.description: "The value of the CPU Utilization gauge which indicates percentage of CPU utilized."

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} CPU 1 min
trigger.description: {HOST.NAME} has had a CPU Utilization above 85 % for 3 samples taken in the last 1 minute 30 seconds.

item.name: cLApCpuAverageUsage
item.description: "This object indicates the percent of average CPU usage of the access point. The statistics window is defined by clsSysStatisticsInterval."

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} CPU Maior que 85 %
trigger.description: {HOST.NAME} has had a CPU Utilization above 85 % for 3 samples taken in the last 1 minute 30 seconds.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} CPU Over 85 %
trigger.description: {HOST.NAME} has had a CPU Utilization above 85 % for 3 samples taken in the last 1 minute 30 seconds.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} CPU Over 85 %
trigger.description: {HOST.NAME} has had a CPU Utilization above 85 % for 3 samples taken in the last 1 minute 30 seconds.

item.name: Overall CPU busy percentage in the last 5 minute period

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} CPU 5 min
trigger.description: {HOST.NAME} has had a CPU Utilization above 85 % for 3 samples taken in the last 1 minute 30 seconds.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} is unavailable by ICMP
trigger.description: {HOST.IP} not responding to ICMP in 1 minutes

trigger.name: Ping loss is too high on {HOST.NAME}
Response time is too high on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Response time more than 200ms for 10 minutes.

ASA CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: OLD-CISCO-CPU-MIB 5 minute exponentially-decayed moving average of the CPU busy percentage. Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: FOUNDRY-SN-AGENT-MIB The statistics collection of 1 minute CPU utilization.

trigger.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: MIB: FOUNDRY-SN-AGENT-MIB The system dynamic memory utilization, in unit of percentage. Deprecated: Refer to snAgSystemDRAMUtil. For NI platforms, refer to snAgentBrdMemoryUtil100thPercent

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

discovery_rule.name: CPU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: If your IOS device has several CPUs, you must use CISCO-PROCESS-MIB and its object cpmCPUTotal5minRev from the table called cpmCPUTotalTable , indexed with cpmCPUTotalIndex . This table allows CISCO-PROCESS-MIB to keep CPU statistics for different physical entities in the router, like different CPU chips, group of CPUs, or CPUs in different modules/cards. In case of a single CPU, cpmCPUTotalTable has only one entry.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-PROCESS-MIB The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 5 minute period. This object deprecates the avgBusy5 object from the OLD-CISCO-SYSTEM-MIB. This object is deprecated by cpmCPUTotal5minRev which has the changed range of value (0..100) Reference: http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/simple-network-management-protocol-snmp/15215-collect-cpu-util-snmp.html

trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

discovery_rule.name: FAN Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of fan status maintained by the environmental monitor.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the fan unit

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Fan is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the fan unit

item_prototype.name: $1 AdminStatus
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: $1 Description
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: $1 InErrors
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: $1 InOctets
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: $1 OperStatus
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: $1 OutErrors
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: $1 OutOctets
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

trigger_prototype.name: Errors on {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: More than 100 in/out errors detected on {#SNMPVALUE}

discovery_rule.name: EtherLike-MIB Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovering interfaces from IF-MIB and EtherLike-MIB. Interfaces with up(1) Operational Status are discovered.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Duplex status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: EtherLike-MIB The current mode of operation of the MAC entity. 'unknown' indicates that the current duplex mode could not be determined.
Management control of the duplex mode is accomplished through the MAU MIB. When an interface does not support autonegotiation, or when autonegotiation is not enabled, the duplex mode is controlled using ifMauDefaultType. When autonegotiation is supported and enabled, duplex mode is controlled using ifMauAutoNegAdvertisedBits. In either case, the currently operating duplex mode is reflected both in this object and in ifMauType.
Note that this object provides redundant information with ifMauType. Normally, redundant objects are discouraged. However, in this instance, it allows a management application to determine the duplex status of an interface without having to know every possible value of ifMauType. This was felt to be sufficiently valuable to justify the redundancy. Reference: [IEEE 802.3 Std.], 30.3.1.1.32,aDuplexStatus.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): In half-duplex mode
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check autonegotiation settings and cabling

discovery_rule.name: PSU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: The table of power supply status maintained by the environmental monitor card.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the power supply unit for errors

trigger_prototype.name: {#SENSOR_INFO}: Power supply is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the power supply unit for errors

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of ciscoEnvMonTemperatureTable (ciscoEnvMonTemperatureDescr), a table of ambient temperature status maintained by the environmental monitor.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current state of the test point being instrumented.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CISCO-ENVMON-MIB The current measurement of the test point being instrumented.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:""}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:""}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available
